Body:
If two syllables in Mandarin have the same vowels but different tones, can the syllables be said to rhyme according to native speakers?

I was tempted to ask this question about all tone languages, but realized that the criteria for rhyming might vary from language to language for all I know.

I will gladly read answers to this question as it relates to other tone languages.
Title: If two syllables in Mandarin have the same vowels but different tones, can the syllables be said to rhyme?

LastEditedUser.AboutMe:
Travelling armchair linguist.

Never studied in an institution but read books and web with probably more breadth than depth.

Always on the road surviving in a strange foreign language, currently Mongolian and Mandarin Chinese.

And I collect dictionaries.
